title: INTERSPEECH_2014_40_abs

sentences.text: This paper deals with the problem of generating the fundamental frequency -LRB- F0 -RRB- contour of speech from a text input for text-to-speech synthesis .
We have previously introduced a statistical model describing the generating process of speech F0 contours , based on the discrete-time version of the Fujisaki model .

One remarkable feature of this model is that it has allowed us to derive an efficient algorithm based on powerful statistical methods for estimating the Fujisaki-model parameters from raw F0 contours .
To associate a sequence of the Fujisaki-model parameters with a text input based on statistical learning , this paper proposes extending this model to a context-dependent one .
We further propose a parameter training algorithm for the present model based on a decision tree-based context clustering .

summary: This paper deals with the problem of generating the fundamental frequency -LRB- F0 -RRB- contour of speech from a text input for text-to-speech synthesis . We have previously introduced a statistical model describing the generating process of speech F0 contours , based on the discrete-time version of the Fujisaki model . One remarkable feature of this model is that it has allowed us to derive an efficient algorithm based on powerful statistical methods for estimating the Fujisaki-model parameters from raw F0 contours . To associate a sequence of the Fujisaki-model parameters with a text input based on statistical learning , this paper proposes extending this model to a context-dependent one . We further propose a parameter training algorithm for the present model based on a decision tree-based context clustering .

Predicate-deals_with.label: deals with
Predicate-deals_with.description: The predicate 'deals with' indicates a relationship where the subject (e.g. paper) addresses or handles the object (e.g. problem), often in a manner that involves analysis, solution-finding, or resolution.

Predicate-introduced_by.label: introduced by
Predicate-introduced_by.description: The predicate 'introduced by' indicates that the subject (in this case, a statistical model) has been presented or explained through some means specified in the object. The connection between the subject and object suggests an act of exposition or explanation.

Predicate-describing.label: describing
Predicate-describing.description: The predicate 'describing' indicates that the subject provides an explanation or characterization of the object. It establishes a relationship between the subject and the object, suggesting that the subject's description accurately represents or captures some essential aspect of the object.

Predicate-has_allowed_us_to_derive_an_ef.label: has allowed us to derive an efficient algorithm based on powerful statistical methods for estimating
Predicate-has_allowed_us_to_derive_an_ef.description: This predicate indicates that a subject (typically a theoretical framework or model) has enabled the development of an efficient algorithm by leveraging powerful statistical methods for estimating. The connection between the subject and object lies in the idea that the subject's underlying principles, assumptions, or mechanisms have been utilized to create a practical solution for estimation.

Predicate-proposes_extending_to.label: proposes extending to
Predicate-proposes_extending_to.description: The predicate 'proposes extending to' indicates that the subject (in this case, an entity such as a paper or proposal) suggests or recommends expanding or applying its scope, principles, or ideas to reach or encompass something specified by the object. The connection between the subject and object is one of extensional relationship, where the subject proposes taking its concepts or frameworks beyond their current boundaries.

Predicate-associate_with.label: associate with
Predicate-associate_with.description: To associate with means to connect or link two entities (subject and object) by establishing a relationship between them. This predicate implies that the subject has some inherent property, characteristic, or attribute that enables it to be linked to the object, often through shared features, patterns, or principles.

Predicate-propose.label: propose
Predicate-propose.description: To propose means to suggest or recommend something as a solution, approach, or idea. It implies presenting an option or plan for consideration and potential implementation.

Predicate-is_based_on.label: is based on
Predicate-is_based_on.description: The predicate 'is based on' indicates a relationship where the subject (e.g., an algorithm, method, or concept) relies on or draws inspiration from the object (e.g., another concept, technique, or framework). This connection suggests that the subject's development, functionality, or underlying principles are influenced by the characteristics, properties, or mechanisms of the object.

Predicate-introduced.label: introduced
Predicate-introduced.description: To introduce means to present or bring into notice something new, such as an idea, concept, method, or entity. In this context, the predicate 'introduced' indicates that the subject has presented or made known the object for consideration, discussion, or understanding.

Predicate-have_introduced.label: have introduced
Predicate-have_introduced.description: To 'have introduced' means to bring something into existence or make it known for the first time. It implies a sense of novelty and often involves presenting, revealing, or making accessible information, ideas, concepts, or entities that were previously unknown or unfamiliar.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is a specific instance or example of a more general concept or category represented by the object. The relationship between the subject and object is one of instantiation, where the subject is a particular manifestation or realization of the broader concept denoted by the object.
